gurmukhi: ਮਨ ਬਾਂਛਤ ਫਲ; ਪਾਵੈ ਸੋੲੀ ॥ ਦੂਖ ਨ ਤਿਸੈ; ਬਿਅਾਪਤ ਕੋੲੀ ॥੨੭॥
transliteration: Man Baanchhat Phal Paavai Soee|| Dookh Na Tisai Biaapat Koee||403||
translation: He will obtain the fruit desired by the mind (who will read or listen to this book) and no suffering will occur to him.403.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਨੈ ਗੁੰਗ ਜੋ ਯਾਹਿ; ਸੁ ਰਸਨਾ ਪਾਵੲੀ ॥ ਸੁਨੈ ਮੂੜ ਚਿਤ ਲਾੲਿ; ਚਤੁਰਤਾ ਅਾਵੲੀ ॥
transliteration: Sounai Goung Jo Yaah(i) Su Rasnaa Paavaee|| Sounai Moondh Chit Laae Chaturtaa Aavaee||
translation: The dumb, who will listen to it, will be blessed with the tongue to speak; the fool, who will listen to it attentively, will get wisdom;

gurmukhi: ਦੂਖ ਦਰਦ ਭੌ; ਨਿਕਟ ਨ, ਤਿਨ ਨਰ ਕੇ ਰਹੈ ॥ ਹੋ ਜੋ, ਯਾਕੀ ੲੇਕ ਬਾਰ; ਚੌਪੲੀ ਕੋ ਕਹੈ ॥੨੮॥
transliteration: Dookh Dard Bhau Nikat Na Tin Nar Ke Rahai|| Ho Jo Yaakiek Baar Chaoupai Ko Kahai||404||
translation: That person will be absolved of suffering, pain or fear, who will even once recite this Chaupai-prayer.404.

gurmukhi: ਸੰਬਤ ਸੱਤ੍ਰਹ; ਸਹਸ ਭਣਿੱਜੈ ॥ ਅਰਧ ਸਹਸ; ਫੁਨਿ ਤੀਨਿ ਕਹਿੱਜੈ ॥
transliteration: Sanbhat Sattrah Sahas Bhanijjai|| Ardh Sahas Phoun(i) Teen(i) Kahijjai||

gurmukhi: ਭਾਦ੍ਰਵ ਸੁਦੀ ਅਸਟਮੀ; ਰਵਿਵਾਰਾ ॥ ਤੀਰ ਸਤੁੱਦ੍ਰਵ; ਗ੍ਰੰਥ ਸੁਧਾਰਾ ॥੨੯॥
transliteration: Bhaadrav Sudiashtaniravi Vaaraa|| Teer Satuddrav Granth Sudhaaraa||405||
translation: This book was competed on the banks of Sutlej on Sunday, the eighth Sudi of the month of Bhadon.
The Lord is One and His Word is True.
The Victory is of the Lord.
The Sacred Utterance of the Tenth Sovereign.

gurmukhi: ਕਮਾਲਿ ਕਰਾਮਾਤ ਕਾਯਮ ਕਰੀਮ ॥ ਰਜ਼ਾ ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ੋ ਰਾਜ਼ਿਕ ਰਿਹਾਕੁਨ ਰਹੀਮ ॥੧॥
transliteration: Kamaale Karaamaat Kaayam Dareem|| Razaa Bakhsho Raazik Rihaakoun Raheem||1||
translation: The Lord is perfect in all faculties. He is Immortal and generous. He is the Giver of victuals and Emancipator.1.

gurmukhi: ਅਮਾਂ ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ਿੰਦਹ ਓ ਦਸਤਗੀਰ ॥ ਖ਼ਤਾ ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ ਰੋਜ਼ੀ ਦਿਹੋ ਦਿਲ ਪਜ਼ੀਰ ॥੨॥
transliteration: Amaan Bakhsh Bakhshiaadah O Dastgeer|| Khataa Bakhsh Rozidiho Dil Pazeer||2||
translation: He is the protector and Helper; He is Compassionate, Giver of food and Enticer.2.
